sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Municipality and Sanitary District Mutual Expenditure Act.

sections.heading: That a sanitary district created under An Act to create sanitary
sections.text:
districts and to provide for sewage disposal, approved June 22, 1917, as
amended, and cities and villages, whether special charter or otherwise,
may mutually join in the hereinafter set forth acts if the city or village
and the sanitary district include substantially the same area and they join
together for the purposes set forth in the act aforesaid.

sections.heading: "Substantially" shall be interpreted to mean that the major portion
sections.text: of the city or village is located in the sanitary district.

sections.heading: The sanitary district by a 2/3 vote of its board of trustees and
sections.text:
the city or village by a 2/3 vote of its corporate authorities may spend
their funds for the purchase of land, for the construction, maintenance,
operation, or enlargement of any sanitary sewer system, including lagoons,
filtration plants and collection systems and all other parts of the system.

sections.heading: Any land or assets of any system to be built, being built, or built
sections.text:
may be transferred from one municipality to the other upon a 2/3 vote of
the corporate authorities of both municipalities involved.

sections.heading: This act shall not apply to sanitary districts in which are located
sections.text: cities or villages of over 500,000 population.
